sentences.en: As chief executive, he assembled a polished stable of celebrities.
sentences.cn: 作为首席执行官，他手下云集了一批优雅的名人名士。

sentences.en: Back at the station the Chief Inspector returned the call.
sentences.cn: 探长回到警察局后回了电话。

sentences.en: Financial stress is well established as a chief reason for divorce.
sentences.cn: 经济压力被确认是导致离婚的首要原因。

sentences.en: He is to remain in the hot seat as chief executive.
sentences.cn: 他将继续留在公司总经理这个不好坐的位子上。

sentences.en: He was recently appointed chief economist at the Bank of Scotland.
sentences.cn: 他最近被任命为苏格兰银行的首席经济学家。

sentences.en: He was to be the commander-in-chief of the armed forces.
sentences.cn: 他将担任武装部队的最高统帅。

sentences.en: his chief rival for the job
sentences.cn: 和他竞争这份工作的主要对手

sentences.en: I am astounded at the comments made by the Chief Superintendent.
sentences.cn: 主管的评语让我大吃一惊。

sentences.en: In the squash court his chief aim is to flatten me.
sentences.cn: 在壁球场上他的主要目标就是击败我。

sentences.en: industry chiefs
sentences.cn: 工业界领袖

sentences.en: Most health chiefs believe the reforms have gone too far.
sentences.cn: 大多数卫生部领导人都觉得改革搞得过火了。

sentences.en: Native American tribal chiefs
sentences.cn: 印第安人部落酋长

sentences.en: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
sentences.cn: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.en: Safety is our chief concern .
sentences.cn: 安全问题是我们的头等大事。

sentences.en: She had many reasons for taking the money, but chief among them was revenge.
sentences.cn: 她拿这笔钱的原因有很多，但最主要的是为了报复。

sentences.en: That's John Gibb, operations chief for New York Emergency Management.
sentences.cn: 那个人是约翰·吉布，纽约应急管理办公室的行动总指挥官。

sentences.en: The Chief Constable's clipped tones crackled over the telephone line.
sentences.cn: 电话线那头噼里啪啦地传来警察局长短促的声音。

sentences.en: The chief editorial writer also blames weak leadership for the current crisis.
sentences.cn: 首席社论员也把当前的危机归咎于领导层软弱无力。

sentences.en: The Chief Inspector disliked being overburdened with insignificant detail.
sentences.cn: 总督察讨厌在细枝末节上没完没了地纠缠。

sentences.en: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.
sentences.cn: 这主要是因为人们更长寿了。

sentences.en: The Chief summoned me downstairs. He was brisk and businesslike.
sentences.cn: 主管叫我到楼下。他做事干练、务实。

sentences.en: the government’s chief medical officer
sentences.cn: 政府的首席卫生官员

sentences.en: The Inspector took out a handker-chief and mopped his brow.
sentences.cn: 检察员掏出手帕，擦了擦眉头。

sentences.en: The programme of sell-offs has been implemented by the new chief executive.
sentences.cn: 新任总裁已经执行了抛售方案。

sentences.en: the prosecution’s chief witness
sentences.cn: 控方的主要证人

sentences.en: The Sultan was still nominally the Chief of Staff.
sentences.cn: 苏丹仍是名义上的参谋长。

words.tran_cn: 酋长或首领的地位或职位

phrases.tran_cn: 总会计师；会计主任，会计处长
(非正式)做多种重要日常工作的人，身兼巨细的人
总工程师；[船]轮机长；主任工程师；总技师
行政长官；董事长；美国总统；（美国的）州长
首席法官，法院院长；审判长
参谋长；司令；办公室主任
副局长；副科长；副处长；副警长；副总警监
(纹章)在顶部；在上部。 参见 -in-chief

phrases.phrase: too many chiefs and not enough Indians
phrases.tran_cn: 酋长太多，族人太少；官多兵少

trans.tran_en: the most important person, or one of the most important people, in a company or organization – used especially in job titles and in news reports
